intro: Ardisia leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that appear in late spring. The plant produces bright red berries that are attractive to birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Ardisia leucocarpa typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and shrublands. Its foliage is evergreen, with glossy, dark green leaves that provide ornamental value in gardens.
